# EverMed.ai - Medical AI Chat Application

## üéØ Project Context
- **Project ID**: evermed-ai-1753452627
- **GCP Region**: europe-west3 (Frankfurt)
- **Supabase URL**: https://hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno.supabase.co
- **Purpose**: Medical AI chat demo using Google's MedGemma model
- **Cloud Run Service**: https://medgemma-hf-endpoint-nq7zmdw52q-ez.a.run.app (Proxy ready, HF endpoint inactive)

## üöÄ Current Status

### Infrastructure & Setup ‚úÖ
- Google Cloud Project created and configured (evermed-ai-1753452627)
- Supabase database deployed with PostgreSQL
- Python 3.10+ environment with FastAPI backend
- Frontend built with Next.js 14 (App Router)
- All development tools and CLIs configured

### AI Models & Integration ‚úÖ
- **MedGemma 4B Configuration**
  - HuggingFace endpoint active and working ‚úÖ
  - Cloud Run proxy successfully routing requests
  - Costs $0.7/hour when running (no Pro subscription required)
  - Automatically pauses after 15 minutes of inactivity
- **Currently Active Models**:
  - MedGemma 4B-IT for medical queries (‚Ç¨0.00027/query + ‚Ç¨0.64/hour) ‚úÖ
  - Gemini 2.5 Flash for simple queries (‚Ç¨0.000001/query) ‚úÖ
  - Gemini 2.5 Pro for complex/image queries (‚Ç¨0.00002/query) ‚úÖ
- **Smart model router implemented** - intelligently routes queries to appropriate models
- Model selector in frontend allows users to choose their preferred model

### Authentication & Security ‚úÖ
- Magic link authentication via Supabase Auth
- JWT token management with refresh tokens
- **NEW**: Using modern JWT signing keys (ECC P-256) instead of legacy HS256
  - Current key type: ECC (P-256) - more secure than shared secrets
  - Legacy HS256 key still active for existing tokens (rotated 2 days ago)
  - Automatic key rotation support
- Terms of service acceptance flow
- Row Level Security (RLS) policies on all tables
- Secure file upload with Supabase Storage

### Backend Features ‚úÖ
- All API endpoints implemented and documented
- Real-time streaming responses
- Conversation context management
- Usage tracking and cost monitoring
- File attachments support
- Rate limiting (10 messages/minute per user)
- Medical disclaimers on all AI responses

### Frontend Features ‚úÖ
- Connected to backend on port 8001
- Model selection dropdown with pricing info
- File upload with drag-and-drop
- Chat history and message persistence
- Usage dashboard for cost tracking
- Responsive design with Tailwind CSS

### Database & Migrations ‚úÖ
- Clean database schema with 4 core tables (chats, messages, attachments, users_ext)
- Usage tracking tables (usage_tracking, daily_usage, monthly_usage)
- All migrations applied and synced
- Development test user configured

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Start the Application
```bash
# Terminal 1: Start Backend
cd /Users/Tom/Arbeiten/Arbeiten/2025_EverMedAi/dev
source venv/bin/activate
uvicorn backend.app.main:app --reload --port 8001

# Terminal 2: Start Frontend
cd /Users/Tom/Arbeiten/Arbeiten/2025_EverMedAi/app/frontend
npm run dev
```

Then open http://localhost:3001 in your browser.

## üíª Development Commands
```bash
# Navigate to development directory
cd /Users/Tom/Arbeiten/Arbeiten/2025_EverMedAi/dev

# Activate Python environment
source venv/bin/activate

# Run backend server
uvicorn backend.app.main:app --reload --port 8001

# Run from anywhere in dev/
python -m uvicorn backend.app.main:app --reload --port 8001

# Test authentication
python test_auth_flow.py

# Test MedGemma
python demo_medgemma_working.py

# Create test user with data
python create_test_user.py

# Generate test usage data
python create_test_usage_data.py

# Use Claude Flow (from dev directory)
./claude-flow sparc "implement medical chat API"

# Supabase CLI Commands
supabase login                    # Login to Supabase
supabase init                     # Initialize Supabase project
supabase link --project-ref hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno  # Link to existing project
supabase db diff                  # Create migration from remote DB changes
supabase db push                  # Apply local migrations to remote
supabase db reset                 # Reset local database
supabase status                   # Check Supabase connection status
```

## üåê Deployed Services

### Primary AI Service ‚úÖ
- **MedGemma 4B via HuggingFace**: https://lf35jsuz0n46b2xy.us-east4.gcp.endpoints.huggingface.cloud
  - Status: ‚úÖ Active and responding
  - Requirements: Valid HF_TOKEN (no Pro subscription needed for inference)
  - Configuration:
    - Model: google/medgemma-4b-it
    - Hardware: Nvidia L4 GPU (24GB VRAM)
    - Cost: $0.7/hour when running
    - Auto-pause after 15 minutes idle
  - **Key Performance Characteristics**:
    - Cold start times: 30-60 seconds after idle periods
    - Warm response time: 4-40 seconds depending on query complexity
    - Auto-pause behavior: Shuts down after 15 minutes of inactivity
    - No HuggingFace Pro subscription required for inference
    - Endpoint stability: Requires occasional manual restart for long-term stability

### Cloud Run Proxy Service ‚úÖ
- **API Gateway**: https://medgemma-hf-endpoint-nq7zmdw52q-ez.a.run.app
  - Status: ‚úÖ Running and actively routing MedGemma requests
  - Purpose: Acts as proxy between backend and HuggingFace endpoint
  - Flow: Backend ‚Üí Cloud Run Proxy ‚Üí HuggingFace Endpoint
  - Currently: Successfully proxying all MedGemma requests
  - Cost: Minimal (~$0.02/hour when active)
  - **Note**: Required when `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=cloud_run`

### Active Services ‚úÖ
- **Supabase Database**: https://hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno.supabase.co
  - PostgreSQL with real-time subscriptions
  - Authentication service
  - File storage for attachments
  - Hosted in Supabase Cloud

- **Google AI Services** (Currently handling all AI queries):
  - Gemini 2.5 Flash - General and simple medical queries
  - Gemini 2.5 Pro - Complex medical queries and image analysis
  - No infrastructure costs (pay-per-use only)

### Ready to Deploy
- **MedGemma 4B**: Endpoint exists but needs troubleshooting (503 error)
- **MedGemma 27B**: Would require HuggingFace endpoint setup (~$5/hour)

### Architecture Flow
When `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=cloud_run` and user selects MedGemma:
```
User Request ‚Üí FastAPI Backend ‚Üí CloudRunService ‚Üí Cloud Run Proxy ‚Üí HuggingFace Endpoint
                                                   (medgemma-hf-endpoint)   (lf35jsuz0n46b2xy)
```

When `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=gemini_only` or user selects Gemini:
```
User Request ‚Üí FastAPI Backend ‚Üí Google AI API (direct)
```

## üèóÔ∏è Tech Stack
- **Backend**: Python 3.10+ with FastAPI
- **Frontend**: Next.js 14 (App Router)
- **Database**: Supabase (PostgreSQL)
- **AI Models (Active)**: 
  - MedGemma 4B-IT (‚Ç¨0.00027/query + ‚Ç¨0.64/hour) - Specialized medical queries ‚úÖ
  - Gemini 2.5 Flash (‚Ç¨0.000001/query) - Fast general queries & title generation ‚úÖ
  - Gemini 2.5 Pro (‚Ç¨0.00002/query) - Complex queries & image analysis ‚úÖ
- **AI Models (Available but not deployed)**:
  - MedGemma 27B-IT - Would require separate HuggingFace endpoint (~$1.20/hour)
- **Deployment**: 
  - Backend: Local development (Cloud Run ready)
  - AI: Google AI API (Gemini models)
  - Database: Supabase Cloud
- **Authentication**: Supabase Auth with magic links

## üìù API Endpoints (Implemented)

### Authentication
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/send-magic-link` - Send magic link email
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/verify-otp` - Verify magic link token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user profile
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/logout` - Logout user
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/auth/accept-terms` - Accept terms of service
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh JWT token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/auth/session` - Get session info

### Chat Management
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats` - Create new chat
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats` - List user's chats
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Get chat details
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Update chat
- ‚úÖ `DELETE /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Delete chat
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/chats/{chat_id}/title` - Update chat title

### Messages
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages` - Send message
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages/stream` - Stream message response
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages` - Get chat history

### File Uploads
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/uploads/chat/{chat_id}/message/{message_id}` - Upload attachment
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/uploads/message/{message_id}/attachments` - Get message attachments

### Usage Tracking
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/usage/track` - Track usage
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/current` - Current session usage
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/daily` - Daily usage stats
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/monthly` - Monthly usage summary
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/costs` - Cost breakdown
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/limits` - Usage limits
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/history` - Usage history

### Provider & Health
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/health` - Health check
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/provider/info` - Provider information
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/provider/health` - Provider health status
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/provider/test` - Test provider

### Development
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/app/test-token` - Generate test JWT token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/app/info` - Development environment info

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Guidelines
- This is a **DEMO/RESEARCH** application
- **NOT** for clinical diagnosis or medical advice
- All AI responses must include medical disclaimers
- Rate limit: 10 messages/minute per user
- Log all interactions for compliance
- Use proper error handling for all Vertex AI calls
- **Authentication is FULLY IMPLEMENTED** - Magic link authentication via Supabase
  - Using modern ECC (P-256) JWT signing keys
  - Legacy HS256 keys being phased out
- **MedGemma is ACTIVE** - Endpoint working via Cloud Run proxy
- **Frontend-backend connection WORKING** - Frontend configured for port 8001
- **Frontend runs on port 3001** - Backend API on port 8001

## üîë Environment Variables
Located in `/app/.env`:
- `PROJECT_ID` - Google Cloud project (evermed-ai-1753452627)
- `VERTEX_AI_LOCATION` - Model deployment region (europe-west3)
- `VERTEX_AI_ENDPOINT_ID` - MedGemma 4B endpoint (4917609735693271040)
- `VERTEX_AI_ENDPOINT_ID_27B` - MedGemma 27B endpoint (7651294709507162112) - not deployed
- `CLOUD_RUN_URL_4B` - HuggingFace proxy endpoint
- `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE` - Currently "cloud_run" (should be "gemini_only" if not using MedGemma)
- `HF_ENDPOINT_URL` - Actual HuggingFace endpoint URL
- `HF_TOKEN` - HuggingFace API token (if using HF directly)
- `GOOGLE_AI_API_KEY` - For Gemini 2.5 models
- `SUPABASE_URL` - Database URL
- `SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` - Public Supabase key
- `SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY` - Private Supabase key
- `FRONTEND_URL` - Frontend URL (http://localhost:3001)
- `MAX_TOKENS_4B` - Max tokens for 4B model (1024)
- `MAX_TOKENS_27B` - Max tokens for 27B model (2048)

## üß™ Testing

### Unit Tests
```bash
# Run backend tests
cd /Users/Tom/Arbeiten/Arbeiten/2025_EverMedAi/dev
pytest tests/backend/

# Run with coverage
pytest --cov=backend tests/backend/
```

### API Testing
```bash
# 1. Test backend health
curl http://localhost:8001/health

# 2. Test authentication flow (complete flow)
python test_auth_flow.py

# 3. Send magic link
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/auth/send-magic-link \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email": "test@example.com"}'

# 4. Test medical queries (will use Gemini as MedGemma is not active)
python demo_medgemma_working.py

# 5. Generate test JWT token (development only)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/app/test-token \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email": "test@example.com", "user_id": "test-user-123"}'

# 6. Create chat (with auth token from step 5)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/chats \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  -d '{"title": "Test Medical Chat"}'

# 7. Send message to chat (replace CHAT_ID)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/chats/CHAT_ID/messages \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  -d '{"content": "What are the symptoms of diabetes?", "model": "medgemma-4b-it"}'

# 8. Test usage tracking
curl -X GET http://localhost:8001/api/usage/current \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```

## üîç Debugging
- FastAPI auto-docs: http://localhost:8001/docs
- Frontend dev server: http://localhost:3001
- Supabase dashboard: https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno
- GCP Console: https://console.cloud.google.com/home/dashboard?project=evermed-ai-1753452627
- Vertex AI Endpoints: https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/online-prediction/endpoints?project=evermed-ai-1753452627
- Supabase logs: `supabase db logs`
- Check API health: `curl http://localhost:8001/health`

### Common Issues & Solutions
- **Authentication redirect loop**: Clear browser cache and localStorage, check for browser extensions
- **404 errors on callback**: Ensure frontend is running on port 3001
- **"Missing required error components"**: Not from codebase - likely browser extension or dev tool
- **JWT token issues**: 
  - Project uses modern ECC (P-256) signing keys
  - Legacy HS256 tokens still valid until expiry
  - If token validation fails, may need to re-authenticate
- **MedGemma 500 errors**: Ensure using dict format: `{"prompt": "...", "max_tokens": 512}`
- **MedGemma cold start**: 
  - First request after idle may take 30-60 seconds
  - Endpoint auto-pauses after 15 minutes of inactivity
  - Monitor at: https://huggingface.co/inference-endpoints
  - Keep endpoint warm with periodic requests if needed for production
- **CloudRunService import error**: Install `aiohttp` dependency: `pip install aiohttp`
- **Token expired**: Use refresh endpoint or re-authenticate

Mobile-First PWA Architecture for EverMed Family Health Features

## Executive Summary
Comprehensive mobile-first Progressive Web App (PWA) architecture for EverMed.ai's family health features, prioritizing offline capability, security, and intuitive mobile UX while leveraging the existing FastAPI/Next.js stack.

## Core Architecture Principles

### 1. Mobile-First Design
- Viewport: 320px minimum, fluid up to 768px, responsive to 1024px+
- Touch Targets: Minimum 44x44px for all interactive elements
- Navigation: Bottom tab bar for primary actions (Home, Family, Records, Schedule, Profile)
- Gestures: Swipe navigation, pull-to-refresh, long-press context menus

### 2. Offline-First Strategy
- Storage: IndexedDB with Dexie.js for structured data
- Sync: Background Sync API with conflict resolution
- Caching: Service Worker with Workbox (cache-first for assets, network-first for API)
- Offline queue for mutations

### 3. Security & Privacy
- Authentication: Biometric (FaceID/TouchID) + PIN fallback
- Encryption: AES-256 local, TLS 1.3 transit, E2E for sensitive fields
- Permissions: Role-based family access (Parent, Adult, Minor, Caregiver)
- Compliance: HIPAA, GDPR, COPPA compliant

## Key Data Models

### Family Member
- Profiles with relationships (self, spouse, child, parent, other)
- Medical info (blood type, allergies, conditions, medications)
- Granular permissions (view/edit access per user)
- Minor status tracking for parental controls

### Health Records
- Types: lab results, prescriptions, appointments, vaccinations
- End-to-end encrypted sensitive data
- Selective sharing with family members
- File attachments support

### Appointments
- Provider and location tracking
- Push notification reminders
- Recurring appointment support
- Family calendar sharing

## UI Component Architecture

### Navigation Structure
- Bottom Navigation: Home, Family, Records, Schedule, Profile
- Header Actions: Search, Notifications, Emergency Button

### Key Mobile Components
- Family Member Cards: 48x48px avatars, swipe actions
- Health Record Lists: Grouped by date/category, offline indicators
- Appointment Cards: Visual calendar icons, reminder settings

## PWA Implementation

### Service Worker Strategy
- Static assets: Cache-first
- API calls: Network-first with cache fallback
- User data: Offline-first
- Documents: Cache-first with background updates

### Offline Sync Architecture
- Queue failed requests in IndexedDB
- Last-write-wins conflict resolution with version vectors
- Background sync on reconnection
- User prompts for conflict resolution

### Push Notifications
- Appointment reminders
- Medication alerts
- Family member requests
- Emergency notifications

## Technical Stack Additions

### Frontend
- PWA: next-pwa, workbox
- Offline Storage: dexie, idb
- Animations: framer-motion
- Charts: recharts
- Forms: react-hook-form + zod
- Notifications: web-push

### Backend
- Encryption: cryptography, pynacl
- Push Services: web-push-python
- Task Queue: celery + redis
- Image Processing: pillow

### Infrastructure
- CDN: Cloudflare
- Push Provider: FCM/OneSignal
- Monitoring: Sentry
- Analytics: Plausible

## Implementation Roadmap (10 weeks)

### Phase 1: Foundation (2 weeks)
- PWA manifest and service worker
- Offline data layer setup
- Base mobile UI components
- Family member data model
- Biometric authentication

### Phase 2: Core Features (3 weeks)
- Family member management UI
- Health record storage with encryption
- Appointment scheduling system
- Push notifications
- Sharing permissions

### Phase 3: Advanced Features (3 weeks)
- Medication tracking
- Health metrics dashboard
- Emergency contacts
- Family health history
- Offline sync conflict resolution

### Phase 4: Optimization (2 weeks)
- Performance optimization
- Progressive image loading
- Advanced caching
- Bundle optimization
- Security audit

## Performance Targets
- First Contentful Paint: < 1.5s
- Time to Interactive: < 3s
- Lighthouse Score: > 90
- Offline Capability: Full read, queued writes
- Bundle Size: < 200KB initial

## Success Metrics
- App install rate > 60%
- Offline usage > 30% of sessions
- Family sharing adoption > 40%
- Push notification opt-in > 70%
- User retention > 80% at 30 days

Full documentation saved to: /knowledge/dev_documentation/FAMILY_HEALTH_PWA_ARCHITECTURE.md

# EverMed.ai - Medical AI Chat Application

## üìÅ Project Structure

- Model selector in frontend allows users to choose their preferred model

### Authentication & Security ‚úÖ
- Magic link authentication via Supabase Auth
- JWT token management with refresh tokens
- **NEW**: Using modern JWT signing keys (ECC P-256) instead of legacy HS256
  - Current key type: ECC (P-256) - more secure than shared secrets
  - Legacy HS256 key still active for existing tokens (rotated 2 days ago)
  - Automatic key rotation support
- Terms of service acceptance flow
- Row Level Security (RLS) policies on all tables
- Secure file upload with Supabase Storage

### Backend Features ‚úÖ
- All API endpoints implemented and documented
- Real-time streaming responses
- Conversation context management
- Usage tracking and cost monitoring
- File attachments support
- Rate limiting (10 messages/minute per user)

## üåê Deployed Services

### Primary AI Service ‚úÖ
- **MedGemma 4B via HuggingFace**: https://lf35jsuz0n46b2xy.us-east4.gcp.endpoints.huggingface.cloud
  - Status: ‚úÖ Active and responding
  - Requirements: Valid HF_TOKEN (no Pro subscription needed for inference)
  - Configuration:
    - Model: google/medgemma-4b-it
    - Hardware: Nvidia L4 GPU (24GB VRAM)
    - Cost: $0.7/hour when running
    - Auto-pause after 15 minutes idle
  - **Key Performance Characteristics**:
    - Cold start times: 30-60 seconds after idle periods
    - Warm response time: 4-40 seconds depending on query complexity
    - Auto-pause behavior: Shuts down after 15 minutes of inactivity
    - No HuggingFace Pro subscription required for inference
    - Endpoint stability: Requires occasional manual restart for long-term stability

### Cloud Run Proxy Service ‚úÖ
- **API Gateway**: https://medgemma-hf-endpoint-nq7zmdw52q-ez.a.run.app
  - Status: ‚úÖ Running and actively routing MedGemma requests
  - Purpose: Acts as proxy between backend and HuggingFace endpoint
  - Flow: Backend ‚Üí Cloud Run Proxy ‚Üí HuggingFace Endpoint
  - Currently: Successfully proxying all MedGemma requests
  - Cost: Minimal (~$0.02/hour when active)
  - **Note**: Required when `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=cloud_run`

### Active Services ‚úÖ
- **Supabase Database**: https://hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno.supabase.co
  - PostgreSQL with real-time subscriptions
  - Authentication service
  - File storage for attachments
  - Hosted in Supabase Cloud

- **Google AI Services** (Currently handling all AI queries):
  - Gemini 2.5 Flash - General and simple medical queries
  - Gemini 2.5 Pro - Complex medical queries and image analysis
  - No infrastructure costs (pay-per-use only)

### Ready to Deploy
- **MedGemma 4B**: Endpoint exists but needs troubleshooting (503 error)
- **MedGemma 27B**: Would require HuggingFace endpoint setup (~$5/hour)

### Architecture Flow
When `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=cloud_run` and user selects MedGemma:
```
User Request ‚Üí FastAPI Backend ‚Üí CloudRunService ‚Üí Cloud Run Proxy ‚Üí HuggingFace Endpoint
                                                   (medgemma-hf-endpoint)   (lf35jsuz0n46b2xy)
```

When `MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_MODE=gemini_only` or user selects Gemini:
```
User Request ‚Üí FastAPI Backend ‚Üí Google AI API (direct)
```

## üìù API Endpoints (Implemented)

### Authentication
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/send-magic-link` - Send magic link email
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/verify-otp` - Verify magic link token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user profile
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/logout` - Logout user
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/auth/accept-terms` - Accept terms of service
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh JWT token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/auth/session` - Get session info

### Chat Management
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats` - Create new chat
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats` - List user's chats
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Get chat details
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Update chat
- ‚úÖ `DELETE /api/chats/{chat_id}` - Delete chat
- ‚úÖ `PUT /api/chats/{chat_id}/title` - Update chat title

### Messages
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages` - Send message
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages/stream` - Stream message response
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/{chat_id}/messages` - Get chat history

### File Uploads
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/uploads/chat/{chat_id}/message/{message_id}` - Upload attachment
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/uploads/message/{message_id}/attachments` - Get message attachments

### Usage Tracking
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/usage/track` - Track usage
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/current` - Current session usage
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/daily` - Daily usage stats
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/monthly` - Monthly usage summary
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/costs` - Cost breakdown
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/limits` - Usage limits
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/usage/history` - Usage history

### Provider & Health
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/health` - Health check
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/provider/info` - Provider information
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/chats/provider/health` - Provider health status
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/chats/provider/test` - Test provider

### Development
- ‚úÖ `POST /api/app/test-token` - Generate test JWT token
- ‚úÖ `GET /api/app/info` - Development environment info

```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/auth/send-magic-link \

  -d '{"email": "test@example.com"}'

# 4. Test medical queries (will use Gemini as MedGemma is not active)
python demo_medgemma_working.py

# 5. Generate test JWT token (development only)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/app/test-token \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email": "test@example.com", "user_id": "test-user-123"}'

# 6. Create chat (with auth token from step 5)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/chats \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  -d '{"title": "Test Medical Chat"}'

# 7. Send message to chat (replace CHAT_ID)
curl -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/chats/CHAT_ID/messages \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  -d '{"content": "What are the symptoms of diabetes?", "model": "medgemma-4b-it"}'

# 8. Test usage tracking
curl -X GET http://localhost:8001/api/usage/current \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```

## üîç Debugging
- FastAPI auto-docs: http://localhost:8001/docs
- Frontend dev server: http://localhost:3001
- Supabase dashboard: https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/hsuhbnohludyqoyggkno
- GCP Console: https://console.cloud.google.com/home/dashboard?project=evermed-ai-1753452627
- Vertex AI Endpoints: https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/online-prediction/endpoints?project=evermed-ai-1753452627
- Supabase logs: `supabase db logs`
- Check API health: `curl http://localhost:8001/health`

### Common Issues & Solutions
- **Authentication redirect loop**: Clear browser cache and localStorage, check for browser extensions
- **404 errors on callback**: Ensure frontend is running on port 3001
- **"Missing required error components"**: Not from codebase - likely browser extension or dev tool
- **JWT token issues**: 
  - Project uses modern ECC (P-256) signing keys
  - Legacy HS256 tokens still valid until expiry
  - If token validation fails, may need to re-authenticate
- **MedGemma 500 errors**: Ensure using dict format: `{"prompt": "...", "max_tokens": 512}`
- **MedGemma cold start**: 
  - First request after idle may take 30-60 seconds
  - Endpoint auto-pauses after 15 minutes of inactivity
  - Monitor at: https://huggingface.co/inference-endpoints
  - Keep endpoint warm with periodic requests if needed for production
- **CloudRunService import error**: Install `aiohttp` dependency: `pip install aiohttp`
- **Token expired**: Use refresh endpoint or re-authenticate

## üöÄ Architecture Overview

### Current Implementation
1. **Authentication System** ‚úÖ
   - Magic link authentication via Supabase
   - JWT token validation middleware
   - Terms of service acceptance flow
   - Session management with refresh tokens

2. **AI Model Integration** ‚úÖ
   - MedGemma 4B for medical text queries
   - Gemini 2.5 Pro for image analysis
   - Smart routing based on query type
   - Streaming responses for better UX

3. **Data Management** ‚úÖ
   - PostgreSQL via Supabase
   - Row Level Security (RLS) policies
   - File uploads with secure storage
   - Usage tracking and analytics

### Architecture Strengths
- Clean separation of concerns
- Type-safe API with Pydantic models
- Secure authentication flow
- Cost-effective model selection
- Scalable for production deployment

## Orchestrated Multi-Agent Development Strategy

## ü§ñ Claude Flow Setup & Agent Architecture

### Initial Setup
```bash
# Initialize Claude Flow with SPARC
npx claude-flow@latest init --sparc

# Start orchestration with UI
./claude-flow start --ui --port 3000

# Initialize project memory
./claude-flow memory store project "EverMed PWA - Sandwich Generation Health Management."
./claude-flow memory store tech-stack "Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind, Supabase, FastAPI"
./claude-flow memory store features "Family Dashboard, Visual Symptom Checker, Medication Verification"
```

### Agent Roles & Responsibilities

| Agent | Mode | Focus Area | Memory Keys |
|-------|------|------------|-------------|
| **ArchBot** | architect | System design, API contracts | `architecture`, `api-design` |
| **UIBot** | ui | Mobile-first components | `components`, `design-system` |
| **CoreBot** | code | Business logic, integrations | `services`, `utilities` |
| **TestBot** | tdd | Test coverage, validation | `tests`, `coverage` |
| **DataBot** | data | Database, migrations | `schema`, `migrations` |

## üìÖ Sprint Structure (2-Week Sprints)

```bash
./claude-flow memory store architecture "[output]"

  "./claude-flow sparc run devops 'Setup Next.js PWA with service worker'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run data 'Design Supabase schema for family members and symptoms'" \
```

### Morning Sync (9 AM)
```bash
# Query previous day's progress
./claude-flow memory query "progress"

# Plan day's parallel tasks
./claude-flow sparc run architect "Review progress and plan today's development tasks"

# Spawn agents for the day
./claude-flow agent spawn ui --name "UIBot" --mode ui
./claude-flow agent spawn backend --name "CoreBot" --mode code
./claude-flow agent spawn tester --name "TestBot" --mode tdd
```

### Midday Check (1 PM)
```bash
# Status check
./claude-flow status
./claude-flow monitor --dashboard

# Resolve blockers
./claude-flow memory query "blockers"
./claude-flow sparc run problem-solver "Resolve integration issues"
```

### Evening Sync (5 PM)
```bash
# Store day's work
./claude-flow memory store "day-[date]" "[progress summary]"

# Generate reports
./claude-flow sparc run report "Daily progress and tomorrow's priorities"

# Cleanup
./claude-flow agent terminate all
```

---

## üìä Memory-Driven Development

### Key Memory Stores
```bash
# Project context
memory/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project-spec         # Overall project requirements
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ user-personas        # Sarah, Marcus, Jennifer profiles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tech-decisions       # Architecture choices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api-contracts        # Endpoint specifications
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component-library    # Reusable UI components
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-coverage        # Testing requirements
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ daily-progress       # Sprint tracking
```

### Memory Queries for Agents
```bash
# Before starting any task
./claude-flow memory query "related-work component-name"
./claude-flow memory query "api-spec endpoint-name"
./claude-flow memory query "test-requirements feature-name"
```

---

## üö¶ Sprint Checkpoints

### Sprint Review Protocol
```bash
# Automated sprint review
./claude-flow swarm "Sprint review and demo prep" \
  --agents 5 \
  --tasks \
    "Generate feature demo script" \
    "Compile test coverage report" \
    "Create performance metrics" \
    "Document known issues" \
    "Prepare next sprint backlog"
```

### Go/No-Go Decisions
```bash
# Automated validation
./claude-flow sparc run qa "Validate sprint acceptance criteria"
./claude-flow sparc run security-review "Security audit for sprint features"
./claude-flow sparc run integration "Full system integration test"
```

---

## üéØ Agent Best Practices

### 1. Small, Focused Tasks
```bash
# ‚ùå Bad: Too broad
./claude-flow sparc "Build complete family dashboard"

# ‚úÖ Good: Specific and focused
./claude-flow sparc run code "Create FamilyMemberCard component with props: name, photo, status"
```

### 2. Parallel When Possible
```bash
# Parallel UI components
./claude-flow batchtool run --parallel \
  "./claude-flow sparc run ui 'Design medication card'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run ui 'Design symptom result card'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run ui 'Design notification badge'"
```

### 3. Memory-First Development
```bash
# Always store outputs
./claude-flow sparc run code "Create API endpoint for symptom analysis" \
  && ./claude-flow memory store "api-symptom-checker" "[output]"
```

### 4. Test-Driven Agents
```bash
# Write tests first
./claude-flow sparc run tdd "Define tests for medication reminder service"
# Then implement
./claude-flow sparc run code "Implement medication reminder service to pass tests"
```

---

## üìà Metrics & Monitoring

### Daily Metrics Collection
```bash
# Automated metrics
./claude-flow batchtool run --parallel \
  "./claude-flow sparc run analytics 'Count completed tasks'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run analytics 'Calculate test coverage'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run analytics 'Measure API response times'" \
  "./claude-flow sparc run analytics 'Track memory usage'"
```

### Sprint Velocity Tracking
```bash
# Weekly velocity report
./claude-flow sparc run report "Generate sprint velocity and burndown charts"
./claude-flow memory store "sprint-velocity-week-[n]" "[output]"
```

## üé¨ Quick Start Commands

```bash
# Daily development start
./claude-flow start --ui --port 3000
./claude-flow memory query "yesterday's progress"
./claude-flow sparc run architect "Plan today's tasks based on sprint goals"

# Feature development pattern
./claude-flow sparc run architect "Design [feature]"
./claude-flow batchtool run --parallel [implementation tasks]
./claude-flow sparc run tdd "Test [feature]"
./claude-flow sparc run integration "Integrate [feature]"

# Problem solving
./claude-flow memory query "[error or issue]"
./claude-flow sparc run debug "Solve [specific problem]"

# End of day
./claude-flow sparc run report "Summarize progress and blockers"
./claude-flow memory store "progress-[date]" "[summary]"
```

---

## ‚ö° Emergency Protocols

```bash
# When blocked
./claude-flow sparc run problem-solver "Unblock [specific issue]"

# When tests fail
./claude-flow sparc run debug "Fix failing test: [test name]"

# When behind schedule
./claude-flow swarm "Catch up on [feature]" --agents 5 --priority high

# When unclear on requirements
./claude-flow memory query "requirements [feature]"
./claude-flow sparc run ask "Clarify [specific requirement]"
```

**Remember**: Claude Flow excels at parallel, focused tasks. Keep each agent's scope small and let the swarm handle complexity through coordination.
